org.openbel.framework.tools
Class PhaseZeroApplication

java.lang.Object
  org.openbel.framework.core.CommandLineApplication
      org.openbel.framework.tools.PhaseZeroApplication

public class PhaseZeroApplication
extends CommandLineApplication

This application validates the command line arguments passed by the belc frontend against all phase applications.

This class supplants a proper frontend to all phases. Each phase application ignores unrecognized options and this class is a safety net to ensure all phases have what they need before executing.

If belc ever dies and the BEL compiler gets a proper frontend, this application should be removed.

getUsage

public String getUsage()
Returns a detailed description of the application's command-line.

Optional arguments should be wrapped in [] brackets. For example: [-o somearg]. Arguments that can occur more than once should be followed with ellipses (...), for example: [-f FILE...].

Specified by:
getUsage in class CommandLineApplication
Returns:
Non-null string

getCommandLineOptions

public List<org.apache.commons.cli.Option> getCommandLineOptions()
Returns command-line options used by the application.

Options specifies by subclasses should adhere to the convention of a single-character short option with an optional long option.

Specified by:
